alert.note: Alert for Riverside; San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 2:22AM PDT until August 21 at 4:30AM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Diego has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The Apple and El Dorado burn scar in... Riverside County in southern California... San Bernardino County in southern California... * Until 430 AM PDT. * At 222 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain over the warned area. Between 5.5 and 11 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Apple and El Dorado Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... San Bernardino, Fontana, Ontario, Victorville, Rialto, Hesperia, Chino, Apple Valley, Redlands and Yucaipa. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Apple and El Dorado Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety.
